availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Florence, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Mary E. Blackburn Dulaney on February 2, 1854. Father of William R. Dulaney and Ellen C. Dulaney. Resident in Boone County, Kentucky in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Boone County in 1850. Physician in Florence in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Florence in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 179B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Florence, p. 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Florence, p. 4.
Find A Grave, "Dr John J. Dulaney (1832-1898)," Memorial #90414192, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/90414192# (accessed September 4, 2018).
